title: Understand the conditions for spontaneity
text: For a chemical reaction to be spontaneous at a constant temperature and pressure, consider Gibbs Free Energy (G). Evaluate the key relationship between entropy (S), enthalpy (H), and temperature (T).

title: Gibbs Free Energy Equation
text: Recall the equation for the change in Gibbs Free Energy: $$ΔG=ΔH-TΔS$$. This helps determine reaction spontaneity.

title: Identify the Sign of ΔG
text: For a reaction to be spontaneous, ΔG must be negative. Consider how this condition can be achieved.

title: Analyze Entropy (ΔS) Context
text: Given that ΔS is negative, it affects the Gibbs Free Energy calculation as it is subtracted in the equation $$ΔG=ΔH-TΔS$$. Think about its impact.

title: Apply the Gibbs Free Energy Concept
text: To find when the reaction is spontaneous, set $$ΔG=ΔH-TΔS$$ to be less than $$0$$.
